intro: Dimerostemma rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its rounded, velvety leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
